page.title: 11ROAD REPAIRS
page.content:
The island's road repairs are carried out by two full-time{O.I.C}workers augmented by one or two others during the spring and summer. Their{H.Q.}is at{Marston Quarry}which is about 1000m north of the council houses.
In summer they{spray the road}with "tar and chips", which are imported, to preserve the surfaces of the island roads. When the roads are re-surfaced the tar-macadam is imported ready made and a special machine is sent from Kirkwall, along with operators, to do the spraying. The local permanent staff are responsible for{snow {clearing}in winter. These workers also {collect refuse}once per fortnight. The refuse is dumped in a quarry at Dalkeith, where all combustible rubbish is burnt.
